name: Rock

feedback.Physical object: A rock exists physically and can be directly touched and observed.
feedback.Fixed/static: Rocks do not change position or form by themselves under normal conditions.
feedback.Material form: It is composed of solid matter, not an idea or concept.
feedback.Passive: A rock has no output, purpose, or autonomous action — it simply exists.

description: A natural, solid aggregate of minerals — stable, perceptible, passive, and widely recognized across cultures.

name: Bridge

feedback.Physical object: The bridge is a tangible structure spanning a distance.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: This bridge was engineered and built by humans.
feedback.Fixed/static: It remains stationary, providing reliable support across space.
feedback.Structural: Its primary function is to bear loads and connect two points physically.
feedback.Perceptible: It is visible and can be sensed directly by sight and touch.
feedback.Material form: Constructed of materials like stone, steel, or concrete.
feedback.Passive: The bridge does not produce any active effect; it passively supports.

description: A man-made structure that enables passage across obstacles like rivers or valleys — essential, visible, regulated, and socially constructed.

name: Oak Tree

feedback.Physical object: An oak tree is a living entity with tangible mass and form.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: It is a naturally occurring biological organism.
feedback.Fixed/static: While it grows, its rooted position remains fixed relative to the ground.
feedback.Perceptible: Its form, structure, and seasonal changes are easily sensed.
feedback.Material form: It consists of biological matter — wood, leaves, bark.
feedback.Passive: The tree acts according to natural processes without intentional output.

description: A biological, self-sustaining organism that grows, changes with seasons, and plays a critical role in ecosystems — material, perceptible, and universally known.

name: Candle

feedback.Physical object: A candle has a definite, tangible shape made of wax.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: It is crafted by humans for the purpose of producing light.
feedback.Fixed/static: The candle’s body remains stationary while burning.
feedback.Perceptible: You can see, touch, and even smell it when burning.
feedback.Material form: Composed of a physical wax substance.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Once lit, it produces light and heat.

description: A man-made object that emits light and heat, transforming itself over time — a symbolic and visible source of illumination across cultures.

name: Clock

feedback.Physical object: The clock occupies physical space and can be touched and seen.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: It is a human invention to measure and display time.
feedback.Fixed/static: The device itself is stationary, although its internal parts move.
feedback.Perceptible: It can be heard (ticking), seen (face/hands), and touched.
feedback.Material form: It is composed of materials like metal, glass, and plastic.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Its function — keeping and showing time — is by human design.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: It outputs the time visually (and sometimes audibly).
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: It processes time signals internally through mechanical or electronic means.

description: A mechanical or electronic device that measures and displays the passage of time, guiding human activities through standardized, communicative signals.

name: Book

feedback.Physical object: A book is a material artifact that can be held, opened, and read.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: It is authored, manufactured, and published by humans.
feedback.Fixed/static: Once printed, the content and structure do not change.
feedback.Perceptible: It is readable, touchable, and sometimes illustrated.
feedback.Material form: Made of paper, ink, binding glue, and covers.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: It encodes meaning through words and images.
feedback.Communicative: Designed specifically to convey ideas and information to readers.

description: A tangible medium that stores and communicates symbolic information, structured to guide human understanding across cultures and contexts.
